faqs.question: Should I inspect a Weatherford ranch property's septic before buying?
faqs.answer: Absolutely. Ranch systems may have limited service history, older designs, and unique configurations. An inspection reveals system condition, remaining useful life, capacity for your intended use, and any compliance issues. This information is essential for accurate property valuation and avoiding expensive surprises.

faqs.question: What soil-specific issues do Weatherford inspections check?
faqs.answer: On sandy loam properties, inspectors assess groundwater protection adequacy and erosion damage. On clay areas, they check for expansion-pressure damage and drain field saturation. Root intrusion from Cross Timbers oaks is evaluated regardless of soil type. Each inspection is tailored to your property's conditions.
